Comments_List: How the projects work, in general. What consulting for a client really looks like. How plans change and how to adjust them. How to perform under time pressure.

The capstone project has been one of the highlights of my time at Yale -- it combines every key aspect that makes a course great: an amazing professor, teamwork, learning new knowledge and skills, and truly collaborative teamwork. I learned new software (Twitter data analysis), new history and politics (Russian and Soviet propaganda), and new facets of how to work with a client on a deadline. Additionally, the chance to present in front of Yale and non-Yale audiences honed my public-speaking skills. The capstone is a significant part of why I chose the Global Affairs major, and I wish it were available to more students at Yale. This was a critical and fascinating experience.
I don't know how this could be improved.
